title: Consumer automobile loans dataset — aloans
text: brief description

title: Consumer automobile loans dataset — aloans
text: data frame 58,118 rows 7 columns: risk_cat Risk category Z Time--event Y Truncation time C Censor indicator (1 = censored, 0 = censored) D Default indicator (1 = default, 0 = default) bond Categorical variable specifying different bonds.

title: Consumer automobile loans dataset — aloans
text: DATASETS SOURCE (get paper)

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: Estimate non-parametric hazard rate truncated censored data

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
code: estimate_hazard(   time,   trunc_time = NULL,   status = NULL,   censoring = NULL,   eval_points = NULL,   return_cdf = TRUE )

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: time vector event censoring times. trunc_time vector left-truncation times. Defaults NULL (truncation), equivalent vector zeros. status event indicator vector (1=event, 0=censored). Defaults NULL (censoring), equivalent vector ones. censoring indicator censoring (1=censored, 0=). Defaults vector 0s NULL. observation treated event status=1 censoring=0. eval_points vector time points evaluate hazard.  NULL (default), calculated sequence delta + 1 delta + m. return_cdf boolean indicator whether return estimated CDF associated hazard rate . Default TRUE

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: data.frame hazard estimate standard errors asymptotic confidence intervals.

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: Point estimate asymptotic confidence intervals calculated based  (can also include brief notation/definitions )

title: Create an alife Object — new_alife
text: Constructs object class alife data frame, validating structure. Note , function mostly internal usage.

title: Create an alife Object — new_alife
text: x data.frame required columns 'alife' object. Defaults empty data.frame.

title: Create an alife Object — new_alife
text: object class alife.

title: Create an alife Object — new_alife
code: # Create a minimal data frame with the required columns df <- data.frame(time = 1:2, n_risk = c(10, 8), n_event = c(1, 1),                  hazard = c(0.1, 0.125), se_log_hazard = c(0.1, 0.1),                  lower_ci = c(0.08, 0.1), upper_ci = c(0.12, 0.15))  # Construct the alife object my_alife_obj <- new_alife(df) class(my_alife_obj) #> [1] "alife"      "data.frame"

title: Plot Method for an 'alife' Object — plot.alife
code: # S3 method for class 'alife' plot(x, col_ci = "skyblue", col_line = "navy", ...)

title: Plot Method for an 'alife' Object — plot.alife
text: x object class alife. Typically output estimate_hazard function. col_ci color confidence interval polygon. col_line color hazard rate line. ... Additional arguments passed base plot function (e.g., main, xlab, ylab, ylim).

title: Plot Method for an 'alife' Object — plot.alife
text: plot hazard rate.
